Some of the parts we know we let off a little

over 60 points so we played a pretty good

Good team win, we moved the ball around a

258.18.text:

261.67.text:
So what's the key to maintaining the energy

266.37.text:
Really it's communication and just talking

You gotta have communication, otherwise we're
just out there you know, just scrambling all

275.45.text: So next time, yeah, we gotta keep communication.

Uh, just, just talking, opening your mouth

285.78.text:
Communicating, just- if you talk to each other
make sure we're in the right positions, everybody

290.19.text:
just checking up on each other and holding
each other accountable, then everything should

293.04.text:
be good, but when we're not talking and people

297.31.text:
to make extra movements which lowers your

301.75.text:
talking to each other and making sure we're
in a good position, we'll be fine.

304.50.text: Congratulations on the dominating win gentlemen.

308.43.text: For Dragon's Lair update, I'm Matt Stovall.

311.41.text:
My next guest came to Howard Community College
from Coppin State University, where he served

316.32.text: as assistant coach for the past 9 seasons.

319.36.text:
He’s coached at the college level since
1985.

321.83.text:
It’s a pleasure to welcome Head Coach Jay
Dull.

327.54.text:
Thank you very much, I'm great, especially
after last night.

330.89.text:
Well, how do you think your team played against
Anne Arundel?

333.71.text:
Well, I feel that we played about as hard
as we've played all year long, and that's

339.60.text:
always been my goal is- is as I've said in
the past, I try to teach effort, and uh, for

348.27.text:
40 minutes, we didn't get our 40 minutes of
effort, but we got about as close as we've

352.99.text:
been all year to getting that, and the final
score indicated that.

357.92.text:
Several players are academically ineligible
for the rest of the season.

362.22.text:
Leading up to Anne Arundel game, did you have
to make any adjustments to practice?

367.24.text:
Yeah, we, we brought on um, three, three guys
that I had originally cut from the team, and

374.06.text:
uh, all three of them have been gracious enough
to come back and help us out.

379.82.text:
As I've said, I'm a teacher of effort, and
um, we had some students that did just a phenomenal

388.12.text:
job academically, and then we had some guys
who underachieved at- in the classroom, and

395.71.text:
that's always a concern of mine because when
guys underachieve it's generally because they

404.15.text:
And um, because that's what I'm trying to
teach here, um, that frustrates me.

410.02.text:
Um, it probably affected me more than it did
our team, and uh, it affected the way I did

417.88.text:
I think the guys kind of read into that, and
I think I had to give myself a pep talk and

422.86.text:
say, you know, if I can't get myself up and
go on then how do I expect them to get up

428.55.text:
So, it affected us but uh, this was our first
game back since that point, and we won and

435.76.text:
had a very, very good outing so I'm happy
with the guys we have left on the, on the

441.70.text:
So it sounds like it presented some challenges
to you guys.

443.47.text:
Can you talk a little bit more about some
of those challenges?

446.21.text:
Well, we were small to start with, um, in
terms of our side, so we had to move some

452.87.text:
guys who were used to playing the perimeter
into what I call the four spot, which is a-

460.21.text:
not necessarily a post spot but you end up
guarding bigger guys.

463.94.text:
Offensively you don't do a whole lot of different
things that you would, uh, would normally

476.26.text:
It also affects us in terms of our teaching,
because we have to teach individuals more

481.58.text:
than one spot, one position, and sometimes
it overwhelms guys.

486.95.text:
Especially with my, my system's not the easiest
thing to learn.

490.22.text:
It's fairly complicated and so guys really
need to be focused and attentive during practice

497.95.text:
because of the fact that they have to learn
more than one position.

502.56.text:
So with all this change in numbers, will you
still continue with this philosophy of pushing

507.75.text:
Or do you now have to pick and choose when
to push the ball?

510.44.text:
Yeah we'll, we'll uh, we won't change a whole
lot.

514.70.text: It's just the way I like to play.

517.87.text:
Um, I try to get our guys in as good a physical
condition as they can be in.

522.99.text:
I like to say we're the best conditioned team
of all the teams that we play in the league

527.73.text:
or in the state or whatever, um, and so they-
they just have to understand that they're

535.78.text: It might affect when you take time outs.

538.18.text:
I like to save my time outs 'till the end
of the game, but I might have to use them

542.28.text:
just to give my guys a rest if we're in fall
trouble.

546.35.text:
Um, you may have to be in a position where
you play a little more zone than you would

552.51.text:
man-to-man, and I don't have a problem with
that, but when it's dictated because of your

558.54.text:
numbers, that's not the way I like to operate,
but there's a lot of ways you can get around

564.69.text:
things is what I'm trying to say, and hopefully
we don't get stuck in a situation where I'm

571.62.text:
trying to play with less than 5 guys on the
floor at the same time cause that's always

577.30.text: What have you seen in scouting Harford?

580.59.text:
You know, I'm, I'm, right now I'm in a position
right now where I really don't have a really

588.08.text:
I saw them early in the year, but with Mike
you know, his teams are always going to be

593.32.text:
fundamentally sound, they're going to play
hard, um, he's a very good recruiter so you

599.25.text: know he's got good players there.

601.64.text:
What I saw from them early in the year, um,
you know, they play a pretty disciplined system.

608.20.text:
Um, they're not out of control, um, so we
got our work cut out for us.

613.58.text: Do you have a game plan against them yet?

616.35.text:
Yeah, you know, we're in a situation where
we're going to basically play the way we always

623.27.text:
We're going to dictate to them what we do,
not let them dictate to us, so, so we're going

630.18.text:
to continue to press until a situation where
they hurt us with it.

637.08.text:
And then we'll counter that with some other
press, and so we'll try to keep the pressure

643.33.text:
Uh, we'll- we'll pressure them, we'll pressure
the ball, we'll play man-to-man, we'll play

648.96.text:
zone, we'll switch it up tryin' to keep 'em
off- off guard and off pace.

655.39.text:
And uh, really not a whole lot different than
any team that we're facing.

660.59.text:
I know our guys are going to be very motivated,
um, some of our guys who played for Mike last

666.29.text:
year um, felt that they didn't get a whole
lot of playing time so they're motivated-

671.32.text:
and Mike was here last night watching our

677.61.text:
maybe that was a motivation why the guys played

683.40.text:
playing time that you thought you deserved
you always want to try to prove something

690.12.text: So uh, you know, there'll be that aspect.

694.10.text:
Mike's a great guy, everybody around this
area you know, speaks so highly of him.

699.15.text:
My contacts that I've had with him have been
very, very good.

703.15.text:
He's been helpful with me and my transition
here, um, offered to, you know, give me any

709.33.text: advice that I needed on anything.

711.29.text:
So it'll be a tough battle, and uh, we're
looking forward to it.

715.79.text:
That sounds like fun, it sounds like a great
season ahead and it sounds like your team

720.62.text: Thank you very much, I appreciate the opportunity.

721.62.text:
It's been very nice talking to you, good luck

726.33.text:
It's time for men's basketball, Howard takes
on Harford.

731.30.text:
This is a game people around here have had
circled on the calendar for a long time.

735.98.text:
Howard takes on former Head Coach Mike Smelkinson
and his Harford Fighting Owls.

740.34.text:
In his three seasons at Howard, Coach Smelkinson
restored the Men's Basketball program.

744.93.text:
Smelkinson inherited a six win team in 2011,
and led them to Nationals in his second season

752.43.text:
Smelkinson brought two of his go-to-guys from
that team with him to Harford.

755.48.text:
Brandon Spain and Alie Kondeh led Howard to
victory in the 2013 Region Championship, combining

761.15.text: to score 43 points in the final.

764.18.text:
Last year, Coach Smelkinson's Dragons won
the MDJUCO regular season title, ending another

768.60.text:
20 year drought, before being upset by Potomac
State in the Region Championship.

773.46.text:
Smelkinson did not bring any players from
that team with him to Harford.

775.85.text:
Those players are still at Howard, they'll
be fired up for this one.

779.01.text:
Chuck, what should we expect to see in this
game?

781.18.text:
This should be a thriller, no doubt about
it.

783.06.text:
A game of attrition, a game of “which team
is standing at the end?”

786.69.text:
Both teams come in riding a four-game win
streak.

789.48.text:
Howard has won seven of its last nine, and
is averaging over 90 points per game.

794.00.text:
They're hot, no doubt about it, but they're
giving up 81 points per game.

798.01.text:
Howard must continue to apply pressure on
both sides of the ball.

801.22.text:
They must get to the free throw line where
they're shooting 65%, and they have to convert

805.45.text: Harford turnovers into their scoring opportunities.

809.35.text:
Harford went 5-22 last year, Coach Smelkinson
has them at 9-10 this season.

813.59.text:
Harford is 4-0 with Brandon Spain in the lineup,
the former Dragon returned from injury January

819.35.text: He's averaging a team-high 15 points per game.

821.81.text: Chuck, what do you expect to see from Harford?

823.72.text:
Well, obviously as you've mentioned, Coach
Smelkinson knows his Dragon's club very well.

828.09.text:
He'll have his team pumped up, no doubt about
this a road game for them, a big road game.

832.54.text:
They'll start out very aggressive on defense,
they'll try to limit basket penetration by

836.53.text:
the Howard guards, and I have a hunch they'll
give up the 3-point shot knowing the Dragons

841.16.text: only shoot 29% from behind the arc.

844.03.text:
Ball control: an issue, taking time off the
clock: a big issue, and the number of posessions

849.39.text: Howard gets is a big issue.

853.66.text:
With pride on the line, Howard and Harford
take the floor next.

863.31.text: Willie Kee, from behind, gets it back.

Robert Goodwin for the alley-oop to Nwosu,

873.35.text:
This time he finds Ian Vasquez in the corner,
three ball...

879.83.text:
Howard here showing a very loose full court
press.

883.08.text:
Harford brings the ball up the floor, gets
that press.

885.83.text: Dragons fall back into their 2-3 zone defense.

890.53.text:
Mike Smelkinson knows the Dragons well, he
looked for that 2-3 zone.

894.18.text:
His team works the ball around, they'll exchange
high post players for perimeter players on

899.83.text: the floor running time off the clock.

902.11.text: Again, the ball moves around the horn.

906.45.text: Warren in the corner, 3 point shot, perfect.

910.18.text: Howard here on defense, half court, man-to-man.

916.88.text: Spain goes down the middle for two.

The high pick and roll opens up the middle

Goodwin penetrates, kicks it out to Connor
Gaskins, no good.

927.92.text:
Nice job boxing out by Harford, quick outlet
pass, nice job beating the Dragons down the

935.64.text:
Kee, able to beat his defender, get into the
lane but the lay-up doesn't fall.

941.20.text: Scrap for the rebound, Kondeh comes up with.

945.38.text:
He's going coast-to-coast, through contact
and one.

949.53.text:
Instead of doing his job and falling back
on defense, Vasquez goes for the steal at

955.41.text:
half court, which is not what Coach Dull wants
to see.

957.65.text:
By not retreating on defense, Vasquez allows
Harford the opportunity for a three point

967.63.text:
They allow Vasquez the three pointer, knowing
the Dragons will only shoot 29% from behind

975.40.text:
A big part of Howard’s game coming up here,
the full court press.

980.35.text:
They love to apply the press after a made
free throw.

983.37.text: The Dragons shoot free throws well.

985.32.text:
It's much easier and with much more success
to apply the press after a made free throw

993.38.text:
A missed free throw, Howard now falls back
into its half court defense.

996.99.text:
The ability to make or miss that second free
throw does set up the entire defensive strategy.

1003.01.text:
This play designed to work against the Howard
man-to-man, guard, high post cut, weak side

1009.06.text:
screen, guard gets the ball, nice move for
the layup.

1012.22.text:
Notice the lack of backside help from the
Howard big man.

1016.27.text:
Harford now looking for an opportunity to
penetrate, which they do, an easy put back

1020.88.text:
for Xavier Cooper, look how easily he gets

1025.68.text:
One minute left in the half, Fighting Owls
with a three point lead.

1030.23.text: Cooper goes up, Austin Nwosu, eh-eh.

1034.30.text:
Vasquez pushes it up the floor, but Brandon
Spain forces the turnover and takes it the

1039.92.text:
Now he's got no numbers, so he pulls up and

1043.89.text:
Twelve first half points for the former Dragon,

1048.32.text: Second half now, 4 point lead for Harford.

Kee, up against Malachi Seney, rattles in

1055.76.text: and makes it a one possession game.

1057.99.text:
Goodwin, guarded by Seney, looking to penetrate,

1066.19.text:
Harford gives up the three, Vasquez burning

Here's Spain, gets inside, Gaskins is there

1079.15.text:
Nwosu hauls in the rebound, he leads the Dragons

1082.88.text: Goodwin now draws some attention in the corner.

1089.73.text: Fouled by Spain, his second personal.

Vasquez makes his free throws, he's scored

1095.96.text:
Cameron Smith, wide open behind the arc, no

1105.76.text:
Takes it himself left hand, attacks the rim,
and he buries it.

1109.08.text: Big time play from the sophomore out of Baltimore.

1111.49.text:
The Dragons Lair is rocking, and Coach Dull,
showing some passion and his players are eating

1117.88.text:
Here's where the momentum of the game may

1120.92.text:
Minutes into the second half the Dragons come

1125.00.text:
Must have been an inspired Dragon locker room
at half time.

1128.93.text: After the Harford timeout, Spain driving.

1132.01.text:
Beautiful feed to Cooper with the two-handed
flush, cuts the deficit to 2 points.

1136.52.text:
The freshman out of Rocky Mountan, North Carloina
had 9 points.

1139.82.text:
Willie Kee against Cedric Hines, goes right,
goes left, pull up jump shot and Connor Gaskins

1144.96.text:
with his fifth offensive rebound in the put
back.

1147.68.text:
The Dragons playing with emotion, responding
to the big game atmosphere.

1154.22.text: Cooper open in the middle, Hines finds him.

1156.49.text: He gets to the rim and a beautiful finish.

1163.98.text:
Kee, denied entry into the lane, bounce pass
to Vasquez.

1171.71.text:
Harford is giving up the three and Howard's
2 for 3 from three point range in the 2nd

1180.77.text: Spain is wide open and he buries the three.

1188.55.text:
Now it's Will Jackson says eh-eh and Brandon
Spain loves it.

1192.43.text: Passion on both sides of this young rivalry.

1194.96.text: 13 minutes to play now, tied at 49.

1197.58.text:
Willie Kee, all the way to the rack, and he

1201.54.text:
The sophomore out of Parkville High School
has 12.

1206.44.text: Goodwin, goes right, stops, pops off the glass.

1211.20.text: The Dragons have a four point advantage.

1213.84.text: Other end of the court now.

1217.42.text:
Terrific pass to Jackson, Nwosu, great reaction,

1221.00.text:
Kee outworks two Owls and Gaskins secures

1226.37.text:
Goodwin pushes the ball and officials here

1230.29.text:
Then they hit him with a T. Vasquez and Goodwin

1237.74.text: Hines, once again, down low to Jackson.

Here’s an example of Nwosu and Gaskins really

1248.97.text:
They make it extremely difficult for Harford

1257.72.text:
Great penetration from Kee, alley-oop to Nwosu,

1262.61.text:
Harford seems to be standing around, perhaps

1269.27.text:
Nwosu missed the free throw, Gaskins grabbed

number 13 with a put back bucket for the Randallstown

1277.54.text:
Harford, not done yet, Coach Smelkinson’s
Fighting Owls, on a 4-0 run.

1283.64.text: Hines gets a hand on the ball.

1291.53.text:
Still seven minutes remaining, Howard’s
lead is down to five.

1294.52.text:
Vasquez, attacking the basket collides with
Kondeh.

1299.16.text:
Vasquez fought through the pain, converts
both free throws.

1301.96.text: Hines on the drive, outside to Floyd.

1309.26.text: Goodwin hits it off the knee of Hines.

1310.59.text:
That is not what Coach Smelkinson wants to
see.

1313.49.text:
Other end of the floor, Kee into the heart

1316.77.text:
Dragons respond with a 4-0 run of their own
and he lead is back to nine.

1322.78.text:
Kee, penetrating once a gain, draws the attention
of Cooper, great feed to Nwosu and Cooper

1328.54.text:
2:53 on the game clock, Harford brings the
press.

1332.84.text:
Goodwin dribbles through, keeps his head up,
and Floyd fouls him from behind.

1341.24.text:
Goodwin knocks down his free throws, and here’s
Robert Goodwin again.

1344.67.text:
Into the paint, floater over the 6’5’’
forward.

1347.63.text:
A 17 Point night for the freshman out of Baltimore,
his 4th consecutive game in double figures.

1358.36.text:
Kee draws the defender here, finds Nwosu all
alone, Retribution for Howard’s sophomores.

1363.50.text:
The five Dragons who played for Coach Smelkinson
last year combine to score 52 points, haul

1370.21.text:
Those five players out-rebounded Harford’s
entire team.

1373.71.text: Howard wins, let’s go to Jaz’mon Harris.

1377.58.text: After tonight's game, how do you feel Connor?

1379.43.text:
I mean, it was an excellent win, you know,
team communication, we worked hard on defense

1385.51.text:
We came out slow, but Coach Dull pumped us
up, got us out there in the second half, and

1390.43.text: we came out with the win.

1392.56.text:
How did Coach Dull prepare you all for this
game?

1512.40.text: Now it's time for Women's Basketball.

1516.15.text:
Coach Anderson's Dragons enter the game with
a 3-8 record.

Howard is coming off of a 10 point win over
Anne Arundel, arguably their best performance

1523.65.text:
Chuck, what do you expect to see from the
Dragons?

1525.79.text:
Well, we know that Howard's a very young team
Mike, and still trying to find some consistency

1529.77.text: on both sides of the ball.

1537.42.text:
This makes it tough for Hagerstown, or any

The downside though, Howard shoots 31% from

1552.11.text: They must improve on these tonight.

Also take better care of the ball, and defend
Hagerstown's low post game.

1559.48.text: Hagerstown enters the game with a 12-2 record.

1561.21.text:
The Hawks have won 10 consecutive games, they're

1565.46.text:
average margin of victory of 20 points against
conference opponents.

1572.16.text:

they've proven to be very dominant in those

1581.19.text:
Strong low post game, excellent passing team,
and despite a roster full of Freshmen, they

1587.46.text:
They're well coached, and they're gonna be

1614.00.text:
Jaz Spruill sends it to Daysha Adams, who
pounds it inside to Olivia Turner, and she

1621.44.text:
Easy to know the game plan for Hagerstown

12 point lead for Hagerstown, West, top of

She takes it to the rim, scoop, 15 point night

1685.00.text: But the deficit proved to be too much to overcome.

81-70 is your final, lets send it down to
